name: rebelliousness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the act of opposing the ideas of the people in authority and planning to change the system, often using force: The area is most famed for its history of rebelliousness leading up to the revolution. civic rebelliousness
the quality of being difficult to control and not behaving in the way that other people expect: teenage rebelliousness Boys are thought of as being more inclined to risk-taking and rebelliousness. See
rebellious
More examplesFewer examplesThe landowners did nothing to tackle the primary source of peasant rebelliousness.He remembered his own youthful rebelliousness.She had an attitude of spoiled rebelliousness.
